title: Rhyming and Word Play

vocab.definition: Words that end with the same sound, like cat and hat
A group of sounds or letters that means something
What you hear when someone speaks
Words that often rhyme and have a rhythm

teachingNotes: Use nursery rhymes and simple poems. Practice clapping syllables. Create class rhymes and word families.

sample.question: Complete this rhyme: 'I like to play every _____'
What rhymes with 'moon' in the sky?
Make up a word that sounds like 'king'.

truefalse.question: The words 'dog' and 'log' rhyme.
expectedAny: dog and log both end with -og sound

truefalse.question: Silly and funny rhyme perfectly.
expectedAny: silly and funny don't end with the same sound

truefalse.question: You can make up new rhyming words.
expectedAny: we can create words that rhyme

truefalse.question: Word play is fun with rhymes.
Every word has a perfect rhyme.
expectedAny: some words don't have good rhymes

multiplechoice.question: Complete the nursery rhyme: 'Mary, Mary, quite contrary, how does your garden _____?'
In 'Twinkle, twinkle, little star', what rhymes with 'are'?
expectedAny: far rhymes with star and are

multiplechoice.question: Which makes the best rhyme with 'bee'?
What word family does 'cat', 'bat', 'hat' belong to?

fillintheblank.question: Hickory dickory dock, the mouse ran up the _____.
Jack and Jill went up the _____.
I can hop like a bunny, I can buzz like a _____.
The cat in the _____ is very silly.
Row, row, row your boat gently down the _____.

shortanswer.question: Can you make up two words that rhyme?
What's your favorite nursery rhyme and why?
Create a silly sentence using words that rhyme.
expectedAny: I see a bee in the tree

shortanswer.question: Name three words that rhyme with 'play'.
How do rhymes make stories more fun?
What rhyming words can you find in your favorite song?
Make up a short poem with two rhyming lines.

wordProblems.question: In 'Jack and Jill', there are 2 rhyming words: 'hill' and 'Jill'. If you add 2 more words that rhyme with them, how many rhyming words do you have?
Anna makes up 5 rhyming pairs. How many words did she create in total?
A poem has 6 lines. If every 2 lines rhyme, how many rhyming pairs are there?
In word family '-at', you know cat, bat, hat. If you learn 3 more -at words, how many -at words will you know?
Danny recites 4 nursery rhymes. If each rhyme has 2 rhyming words, how many rhyming words did he say?
There are 8 children in circle time. If 5 children can make up rhymes, how many children still need practice?
Kate knows 7 words that rhyme with 'sun'. If she teaches 3 of them to her friend, how many does she still know?
expectedAny: she still knows all of them
